Package plotly.fastCharts

Class PlotlyHeatMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control
        • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Scrollable
          • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
            • plotly.fastCharts.PlotlyHeatMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, org.eclipse.rap.rwt.Adaptable, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable, org.eclipse.swt.internal.SerializableCompatibility
    public class PlotlyHeatMap
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
    Invoke this class to build a fast HeatMap chart.
    Call PlotlyHeatMap(Composite parent, int style, double[][] datas) to obtain this composite.

    Exemple:
    double[][] datas = { { 20.5, 40.5, 39 }, { 33, 33, 34 } };
    plotlyHeatMap ph = new PlotlyHeatMap(HomeComposite, SWT.NONE, datas);
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Benoit Boucounaud
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • upHoverInfo

        public void upHoverInfo​(java.lang.String infos)
        To update hoverInfo.
        Info :
        https://plot.ly/javascript/reference/#heatmap-hoverinfo

        Sets hover text elements associated with each sector. If a single string, the same string appears for all data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order of this trace's sectors.
        Parameters:
        infos - String - Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering.

      • upOptions

        public void upOptions​(int option,
                      boolean bool)
        To update plot's options.
        Parameters:
        option - int - Option to change :
        • 1 : showLink
        • 2 : scrollZoom
        • 3 : staticPlot
        • 4 : displayModeBar
        • 5 : displaylogo
        bool - boolean - Option's value.
